Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[WIKI TYPO] Typo in "Branding the NuGet Gallery"" (#9113) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

There is a typo in the "Branding the NuGet Gallery" wiki.

In the [Clone The Gallery](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/wiki/Branding-the-NuGet-Gallery#clone-the-gallery) section in point 3 you are missing a "h" in the URL, the URL is https://gitub.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git but should be https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git

Cheers

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[WIKI TYPO] Typo in "Branding the NuGet Gallery"" (#9113) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Many SPDX license Expressions not resolved by https://licenses.nuget.org/ instead "We have no information regarding the 'Xyz' license."" (#9097) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

dotnet 

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. create a Visual Studio Project Nuget Package with an SPDX Expression e.g. <PackageLicenseExpression>Hippocratic-2.1</PackageLicenseExpression>
2. build, pack and push the Package using an Azure pipeline 
3. Visit the Package Feed / Artifact Page in Azure 
4. Search for the new Package 
5. Click the Project License Link in the bottom right Corner which links to https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 
6. Get an Error Message: We have no information regarding the 'Hippocratic-2.1' license. 

The https://spdx.org/licenses/ Page lists many licenses, 
but it seems only a few work, e.g. MIT, MIT-0, LGPL-2.0-only and MPL-1.0 

Many Licenses listed on https://spdx.org/licenses/  don't work and the link https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 displays a page with an error message reading "We have no information regarding the 'Hippocratic-2.1' license."

I understand that maintaining the full List is a lot of work, but it would be good to at least 
* include a Link to the SPDX License https://spdx.org/licenses/Hippocratic-2.1.html 
* or a Link the List https://spdx.org/licenses/ 
in the Message when it cannot be found on https://licenses.nuget.org  

Best Regards...

### Verbose Logs

```shell
https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 does not link to or mirror 
https://spdx.org/licenses/Hippocratic-2.1
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: `dotnet add "x.csproj" package y` adds NuGet package instead of updating existing `<PackageReference>`" (#11792) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.202

### Worked before?

Don't know

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Moved from https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/25209

### Describe the bug
`dotnet add "your.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging` command does not update `<PackageReference><Version></Version></PackageReference>` template:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905878/166697188-755190a6-a5eb-4675-861f-7d278c8dab57.png)

But `dotnet remove "your.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging` works with both templates:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905878/166697574-2f548167-c48b-44ef-9887-76b38fd5c4fa.png)

It also doesn't update NuGet packages in "new" template. See https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/25209#issuecomment-1117613201
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905878/166819341-65dc60f0-4a10-4a28-9866-60409650af98.png)

### To Reproduce

1. Your `csproj` file must contain this:
```
<PackageReference Include="SimpleInjector.Packaging">
  <Version>4.10.2</Version>
</PackageReference>
```
2. Run `dotnet add "your.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging`

<!--
We ‚ù§ code! Point us to a minimalistic repro project hosted in a GitHub repo, Gist snippet, or other means to see the isolated behavior.

We may close this issue if:
- the repro project you share with us is complex. We can't investigate custom projects, so don't point us to such, please.
- if we will not be able to repro the behavior you're reporting
-->

### Further technical details
- Include the output of `dotnet --info`:
```
Zestaw .NET SDK (odzwierciedlenie dowolnego pliku global.json):
 Version:   6.0.202
 Commit:    f8a55617d2

Srodowisko uruchomieniowe:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19043
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.202\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 6.0.4
  Commit:  be98e88c76
```
- The IDE (VS / VS Code/ VS4Mac) you're running on, and its version: **CLI**

### Verbose Logs

```shell
There is no `--verbosity` option for `dotnet add package`...

Here is standard output:

Running command first time:

dotnet add "bbb.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging
  Trwa okreslanie projekt√≥w do przywr√≥cenia...
  Writing C:\Users\Adam\AppData\Local\Temp\tmp8AB8.tmp
info : Dodawanie elementu PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" do projektu ,bbb.csproj".
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/index.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/1.4.2.12140/3.1.2.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/3.1.3/4.8.0-alpha1.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/4.8.0-alpha2/5.0.0.json
info : Trwa przywracanie pakiet√≥w dla elementu C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj...
info : Pakiet ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" jest zgodny ze wszystkimi strukturami okreslonymi w projekcie ,bbb.csproj".
info : Element PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" w wersji ,5.0.0" zostal dodany do pliku ,C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj".
info : Generowanie pliku programu MSBuild C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\bbb.csproj.nuget.g.props.
info : Generowanie pliku programu MSBuild C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\bbb.csproj.nuget.g.targets.
info : Zapisywanie pliku zasob√≥w na dysk. Sciezka: C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\project.assets.json
log  : Przywr√≥cono element C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj (w 314 ms).
```

Running second time:
```
dotnet add "bbb.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging
  Trwa okreslanie projekt√≥w do przywr√≥cenia...
  Writing C:\Users\Adam\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpBD1E.tmp
info : Dodawanie elementu PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" do projektu ,bbb.csproj".
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/index.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/1.4.2.12140/3.1.2.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/3.1.3/4.8.0-alpha1.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/4.8.0-alpha2/5.0.0.json
info : Trwa przywracanie pakiet√≥w dla elementu C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj...
info : Pakiet ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" jest zgodny ze wszystkimi strukturami okreslonymi w projekcie ,bbb.csproj".
info : Element PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" w wersji ,5.0.0" zostal dodany do pliku ,C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj".
info : Plik zasob√≥w nie ulegl zmianie. Zapisywanie pliku zasob√≥w jest pomijane. Sciezka: C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\project.assets.json
log  : Przywr√≥cono element C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj (w 133 ms).
```
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Visual Studio Package Install Deep Link Proposal" (#11047) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi everyone! 

Here is my proposal for supporting Visual Studio NuGet Package Manager UI deep links. We have significant evidence that users vastly prefer installing NuGet packages via the PMUI in Visual Studio.

This proposal is meant enable users to install packages through the VS PMUI even when their decision to install occurs outside of VS, such as on NuGet.org, from a coworkers suggestions, or a documentation page.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: There is no black arrow install button on the right of custom feed package when hovering on the package in ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab of PM UI" (#11757) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.24

### Worked before?

Dev\6.3.0.12

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. File->New Project->Visual F#, create a Console Application project. 
2. Open Package Manager Settings dialog (Tools->NuGet Package Manager->Package Manager Settings). 
3. Add a custom feed source, type in the name is 'Myget' and the source is https://www.myget.org/F/andy-nuget-project/api/v2. 
4. Start NuGet Package Manager dialog and select the ‚ÄòMyget‚Äô package source. 
5. Go to ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab and hover on the package 'knockoutjs'.

## Expected
There is a black download arrow on the right of package list in ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù Tab when hovering on the package as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/163995283-6912e272-5c15-4f2a-8c76-c78dac2462b0.png)

## Actual
There is no black arrow install button on the right of custom feed package when hovering on the package as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/163995344-9660c421-f5f3-4f8d-8df5-f33b70eedba9.png)

## Notes
1. This issue does not repro on NuGet Client Dev\6.3.0.12.
2. This issue does not repro on NuGet public feed.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature] Error on multiple entries for the same package ids in Directory.Packages.props" (#9467) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Error on multiple entries for the same package ids in Directory.Packages.props.

In the current  design the first declared entry is honored and the others are ignored. 


Note: consider the support for version override. See [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9465)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: dotnet list package report with definable column widths" (#11790) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

an option to specify the minimum width of the package name column in the list packages report

### Additional Context and Details

I would like to use the dotnet package list command to inspect all the packages in a project and compare the packages referenced between builds. I use this to monitor the changes to packages, especially transitive ones between builds. It would be very convenient if the column with was configurable so the layout didn't change depending on the length of the package names, then i wouldn't need to do any post processing on the file

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[DCR]: Include caught exceptions as inner exceptions when rethrowing (in MsBuildUtility)" (#11766) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe

### Current Behavior

When MsBuildUtility catches certain exceptions, it throws different exceptions, including only the outermost one or two messages from caught exception.

### Desired Behavior

When catching an exception and throwing a different one, the original exception should be included as an inner exception so that all original call stacks and messages are preserved, to make debugging more efficient.

### Additional Context

I found these two exceptions (https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4588/) when addressing #8373.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Operated failed. No projects supported by NuGet in the solution throws for a upgraded NetCore project" (#7216) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
From https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/139176/operated-failed-no-projects-supported-by-nuget-in.html?childToView=315343#comment-315343 

For a working example of this error, open Lynda.com, go to the Course named Learning Entity Framework Core. The instructor provides sample code written as a console app for .net core 1.0

On first opening the first solution, it asks if you wan to upgrade the solution with a 1 way upgrade. choose "Yes".
Once it has finished upgrading and has opened the solution, you will notice the Microsoft.NETCore.App(1.0.4) has warning symbols on it (under Solution 'DemoConsole' > src > DemoConsole > Dependencies > SDK)
Go to the tools menu, and choose Manage NuGet Packeges for Solution
You will see the error message "Operation Failed. No project supported by NuGet in the solution"

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: dotnet list [projet | solution] package does not work with solution filters" (#11789) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.202

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

`dotnet restore` works with [solution filters](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/msbuild/solution-filters?view=vs-2022).

`dotnet list solution.slnf package --vulnerable` fails with

```
error: Parameter "xml" cannot be null.

Usage: NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.dll package list [arguments] [options]
```

Not sure if this is a bug or a feature that has not been implemented.

### Verbose Logs

```shell
dotnet list solution.slnf package --vulnerable

The following sources were used:
   https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
   C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\

error: Parameter "xml" cannot be null.


Usage: NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.dll package list [arguments] [options]

Arguments:
  <PROJECT | SOLUTION>  A path to a project, solution file or directory.

Options:
  -h|--help               Show help information
  --force-english-output  Forces the application to run using an invariant, English-based culture.
  --framework             Specifies the target framework for which the packages will be listed.
  --deprecated            Displays only the packages marked deprecated by the authors.
  --outdated              Displays only the packages that need updates with the latest version from the sources.
  --vulnerable            Displays only the packages flagged as vulnerable.
  --include-transitive    Includes transitive packages too in the result.
  --include-prerelease    Considers prerelease versions when looking for latest. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --highest-patch         Considers only the versions with matching minor and major. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --highest-minor         Considers only the versions with matching major. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --source                Sources to lookup for latest versions. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --config                A path to a config file to specify sources. Works only with `--outdated`.
  --interactive           Allow the command to block and require manual action for operations like authentication.
  -v|--verbosity          Set the verbosity level of the command. Allowed values are q[uiet], m[inimal], n[ormal], d[etailed], and diag[nostic].
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org" (#61) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: We announced plans to require tFA on all accounts on NuGet.org. Details in the [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/requiring-two-factor-authentication-on-nuget-org/).

Tweets.Text:
üì¶Quickly Map Your NuGet Packages to Sourcesüì¶

üîß dotnet tool available today on https://t.co/F9kiKfvqkS.
üìç Single co‚Ä¶ https://t.co/vL4fx6HVLt

üì¶Introducing Central Package Managementüì¶

üì• Manage dependencies in a central location.
üìå Transitive package version‚Ä¶ https://t.co/koNbWTt5m2

Hi friends,
